models.question: 'Life is better today than it was 100 years ago.' Do you agree?

default.introduction: Nowadays, there is considerable debate about whether life today is better than in the past. From my perspective, modern life is significantly better due to remarkable advances in health, entertainment and communication.

body1.listing: To begin with, it seems that
body1.opinion: healthcare plays an essential role ...... (reason → example → result)

body2.listing: Furthermore, it is generally argued that
body2.opinion: entertainment options have expanded ...... (reason → example → result)

body3.listing: In addition, as far as I can judge
body3.opinion: technology has transformed ...... (reason → example → contrast)

default.conclusion: In conclusion, I am convinced that life today is much better than a century ago. Overall, improvements in health, entertainment and technology demonstrate remarkable human progress.

alternative1.introduction: It is widely recognised that considerable discussion exists about quality of life today compared to the past. In my view, contemporary life offers substantial improvements, particularly regarding healthcare, entertainment and communication technology.

body1.listing: Firstly, it seems that
body1.opinion: medical advances represent the most important improvement ...... (reason → example → result)

body2.listing: Secondly, it is generally argued that
body2.opinion: entertainment possibilities have grown ...... (reason → example → result)

body3.listing: Moreover, as far as I can judge
body3.opinion: communication technology has revolutionized ...... (reason → example → contrast)

alternative1.conclusion: To sum up, I strongly believe life has improved dramatically over the past century. Taking everything into account, advances in medicine, entertainment and communication show significant progress.

alternative2.introduction: In recent times, many people debate whether modern life surpasses life in previous centuries. From my point of view, today's world is considerably better, especially concerning healthcare, entertainment and communication.

body1.listing: To begin with, it seems that
body1.opinion: modern life is vastly improved medical care ...... (reason → example → result)

body2.listing: Additionally, it is generally argued that
body2.opinion: entertainment choices have increased ...... (reason → example → result)

body3.listing: Furthermore, as far as I can judge
body3.opinion: modern technology has completely transformed ...... (reason → example → contrast)

alternative2.conclusion: In conclusion, I firmly believe contemporary life far surpasses life a century ago. On balance, healthcare, entertainment and communication improvements represent tremendous human advancement.

models.question: Is it better to earn a lot of money or to enjoy your job?
writingPoints: how much time is spent at work
the type of work which is done
job satisfaction and mental health (your own idea)

default.introduction: Few people would deny that work is an essential part of modern life. In recent times, there has been considerable debate about job satisfaction versus high salaries. Therefore, it is vital we analyse the benefits and drawbacks of both options.

body1.listing: To begin with, it seems that
body1.opinion: the main advantage of earning a high salary is ...... (reason → example → result)

body2.listing: Secondly, it is generally argued that
body2.opinion: one other benefit of job satisfaction ...... (reason → example → contrast)

body3.listing: On the other hand, as far as I can judge
body3.opinion: the main drawback of focusing only on money is ...... (reason → example → result)

default.conclusion: In conclusion, both money and enjoyment have clear advantages. On balance, finding work that provides both purpose and reasonable income would be the ideal solution.

alternative1.introduction: It is widely recognised that work plays a central role in our daily lives. Nowadays, many people debate whether earning lots of money or enjoying your job is more important. Hence, it is essential to consider the advantages and disadvantages of each.

body1.listing: To begin with, it seems that
body1.opinion: one key benefit of high-paying jobs is ...... (reason → example → result)

body2.listing: Secondly, it is generally argued that
body2.opinion: despite these benefits, enjoying your work brings ...... (reason → example → contrast)

body3.listing: On the other hand, as far as I can judge
body3.opinion: the main drawback is that ...... (reason → example → result)
body3.argument: job satisfaction has serious effects on mental wellbeing

alternative1.conclusion: To sum up, both high earnings and job enjoyment offer real benefits. On balance, the ideal situation combines meaningful work with adequate financial rewards.

alternative2.introduction: It is common knowledge that employment occupies a huge portion of our lives. Recently, considerable discussion has emerged about whether money or job satisfaction should be prioritized. Therefore, it is important to examine both sides of this debate carefully.

body1.listing: To begin with, it seems that
body1.opinion: the primary advantage of earning excellent money is ...... (reason → example → result)

body2.listing: Secondly, it is generally argued that
body2.opinion: although high salaries have benefits, workplace happiness ...... (reason → example → contrast)

body3.listing: On the other hand, as far as I can judge
body3.opinion: the main drawback is that ...... (reason → example → result)
body3.argument: mental health depends heavily on fulfilling employment

alternative2.conclusion: In conclusion, salary and satisfaction both provide significant advantages. Taking everything into account, combining enjoyable work with decent pay represents the best outcome.

models.question: 'We should do everything we can to save animals which are in danger of disappearing from our planet.' Do you agree?
writingPoints: the kind of animals which are in danger
the reasons for protecting these animals

default.introduction: In recent years, protecting endangered animals has attracted increasing attention from both the public and environmental experts worldwide. I strongly believe that we should do everything possible to save them for future generations.

body1.listing: To begin with, it seems that
body1.opinion: many magnificent species are currently ...... (reason → example → result)

body2.listing: Furthermore, it is generally argued that
body2.opinion: there are compelling reasons to protect ...... (reason → example → result)

body3.listing: In addition, as far as I can judge
body3.opinion: ecosystem balance depends ...... (reason → example → result)

default.conclusion: In conclusion, I firmly believe endangered animals must be protected urgently. Taking everything into account, conservation benefits both nature and humanity significantly.

alternative1.introduction: Nowadays, the protection of endangered species has become a major concern for environmentalists and governments globally. From my perspective, maximum effort should be dedicated to saving threatened wildlife.

body1.listing: Firstly, it seems that
body1.opinion: numerous incredible animal species face ...... (reason → example → result)

body2.listing: Secondly, it is generally argued that
body2.opinion: protecting endangered animals makes sense for ...... (reason → example → result)

body3.listing: Moreover, as far as I can judge
body3.opinion: biodiversity is absolutely essential for ...... (reason → example → result)

alternative1.conclusion: To sum up, I am convinced that protecting endangered species should be an urgent priority. Overall, wildlife conservation protects both natural ecosystems and human interests.

alternative2.introduction: Over recent decades, endangered animal conservation has emerged as a critical environmental issue worldwide. In my view, society must make every effort to prevent species extinction.

body1.listing: To start with, it seems that
body1.opinion: countless remarkable animals currently risk ...... (reason → example → result)

body2.listing: Additionally, it is generally argued that
body2.opinion: strong reasons exist for prioritizing ...... (reason → example → result)

body3.listing: What is more, as far as I can judge
body3.opinion: balanced ecosystems require ...... (reason → example → result)

alternative2.conclusion: In conclusion, I completely agree that endangered animals deserve maximum protection. On balance, conservation efforts benefit both the natural world and human wellbeing.

models.question: Which is more important – friends or family?
writingPoints: who you can enjoy yourself with
who will help you when you have problems

default.introduction: It is widely recognised that relationships are essential to our happiness and wellbeing. In recent times, there has been considerable debate about the value of friendships compared with family ties. Hence, it is vital to consider the benefits of both.

body1.listing: To begin with, it seems that
body1.opinion: the main advantage of friends is ...... (reason → example → result)
body1.argument: they provide enjoyment and shared interests

body2.listing: Secondly, it is generally argued that
body2.opinion: while there are many advantages to friendships, family provides ...... (reason → example → contrast)

body3.listing: On the other hand, as far as I can judge
body3.opinion: different relationships matter ...... (reason → example → result)

default.conclusion: In conclusion, both friends and family are extremely valuable. On balance, family support proves more reliable, but both contribute significantly to our happiness.

alternative1.introduction: Few people would deny that personal relationships play a crucial role in our lives. Nowadays, many people discuss whether friendships or family connections matter most. Therefore, it is important to analyse the advantages of each type of relationship.

body1.listing: To begin with, it seems that
body1.opinion: one key benefit of friendships is ...... (reason → example → result)
body1.argument: the fun and enjoyment they bring

body2.listing: Secondly, it is generally argued that
body2.opinion: despite these benefits, family relationships offer ...... (reason → example → contrast)

body3.listing: On the other hand, as far as I can judge
body3.opinion: the importance of each relationship type varies ...... (reason → example → result)

alternative1.conclusion: To sum up, friendships and family both offer significant value. Taking everything into account, family proves more dependable, though both relationships enhance wellbeing considerably.

alternative2.introduction: It is common knowledge that strong relationships are fundamental to human happiness. Recently, considerable discussion has emerged about whether friends or family matter more. Hence, it is essential to examine what each type of relationship offers.

body1.listing: To begin with, it seems that
body1.opinion: the primary advantage of having good friends is ...... (reason → example → result)
body1.argument: the pleasure and shared experiences they provide

body2.listing: Secondly, it is generally argued that
body2.opinion: although friendships have benefits, family offers ...... (reason → example → contrast)
body2.argument: more dependable support in difficult situations

body3.listing: On the other hand, as far as I can judge
body3.opinion: which relationships we prioritize changes ...... (reason → example → result)

alternative2.conclusion: In conclusion, both relationship types are highly valuable. On balance, family connections prove more reliable, yet both contribute meaningfully to happiness.

models.question: Do you think the world's pollution problems can be solved?

default.introduction: Nowadays, pollution has become an increasingly serious problem affecting the entire planet. It is widely recognised that pollution damages health and the environment significantly. Hence, it is vital to examine the main problems and explore practical solutions.

body1.listing: Firstly, it seems that
body1.opinion: transport causes significant ...... (reason → example → result)

body2.listing: Secondly, it is generally argued that
body2.opinion: rivers and seas are being contaminated by ...... (reason → example → result)

body3.listing: However, as far as I can judge
body3.opinion: renewable energy offers a very promising solution ...... (reason → example → conditional result)

default.conclusion: In conclusion, I believe pollution can be addressed effectively through determined action. Overall, combining cleaner transport, stricter regulations and renewable energy will protect our planet.

alternative1.introduction: These days, pollution represents a growing threat to environmental and human health globally. Few people would deny that pollution causes serious damage to nature and people alike. Therefore, it is important to identify key pollution sources and discuss effective solutions.

body1.listing: To begin with, it seems that
body1.opinion: vehicle emissions create severe ...... (reason → example → result)
body1.argument: air pollution problems in urban areas

body2.listing: Additionally, it is generally argued that
body2.opinion: water pollution from industry and plastic waste threatens ...... (reason → example → result)

body3.listing: Nevertheless, as far as I can judge
body3.opinion: renewable energy sources provide an effective answer ...... (reason → example → conditional result)

alternative1.conclusion: To sum up, it seems to me that pollution problems can be solved through committed efforts. Taking everything into account, sustainable transport, environmental laws and clean energy offer real solutions.

alternative2.introduction: In recent years, pollution has emerged as one of humanity's most urgent environmental challenges. It is generally acknowledged that pollution harms both ecosystems and public health severely. Hence, it is essential to analyse major pollution causes and evaluate potential remedies.

body1.listing: One serious problem is that
body1.opinion: transportation generates massive ...... (reason → example → result)

body2.listing: Another major issue is that
body2.opinion: industrial pollution and plastic contaminate ...... (reason → example → result)

body3.listing: Fortunately, as far as I can judge
body3.opinion: clean energy technology presents a viable solution ...... (reason → example → conditional result)

alternative2.conclusion: In conclusion, from my perspective, pollution challenges are solvable with serious commitment. On balance, implementing eco-friendly transport, tougher regulations and renewable power will safeguard the environment.

models.question: Is taking a gap year before university a good idea?

default.introduction: Over the past few years, gap years have become increasingly popular among young people before university. It is widely recognised that taking time off from education can have both positive and negative effects. Hence, it is vital to analyse the advantages and disadvantages carefully.

body1.listing: To begin with, it seems that
body1.opinion: the main advantage of gap years is ...... (reason → example → result)
body1.argument: gaining valuable life experience and independence

body2.listing: Secondly, it is generally argued that
body2.opinion: while there are many advantages, gap years also present ...... (reason → example → contrast)

body3.listing: On the other hand, as far as I can judge
body3.opinion: financial considerations are extremely significant ...... (reason → example → result)

default.conclusion: In conclusion, gap years have both benefits and drawbacks. On balance, they benefit motivated students who plan carefully and remain committed.

alternative1.introduction: In recent times, taking a gap year has grown considerably in popularity before starting university. Few people would deny that pausing education temporarily creates both opportunities and risks. Therefore, it is important to examine the benefits and drawbacks of this choice.

body1.listing: To begin with, it seems that
body1.opinion: one key benefit of gap years is ...... (reason → example → result)
body1.argument: developing valuable real-world experience and self-reliance

body2.listing: Secondly, it is generally argued that
body2.opinion: despite these benefits, gap years carry ...... (reason → example → contrast)

body3.listing: On the other hand, as far as I can judge
body3.opinion: money matters represent important factors ...... (reason → example → result)

alternative1.conclusion: To sum up, gap years offer both advantages and disadvantages. Taking everything into account, they suit well-organized students with clear goals and strong determination.

alternative2.introduction: Nowadays, many school leavers choose to take gap years before beginning university courses. It is common knowledge that delaying higher education presents both positive and negative aspects. Hence, it is essential to consider what gap years offer and what challenges they pose.

body1.listing: To begin with, it seems that
body1.opinion: the primary advantage of taking a gap year is ...... (reason → example → result)
body1.argument: acquiring meaningful experience and personal independence

body2.listing: Secondly, it is generally argued that
body2.opinion: although gap years have benefits, they also involve ...... (reason → example → contrast)

body3.listing: On the other hand, as far as I can judge
body3.opinion: financial issues play crucial roles ...... (reason → example → result)

alternative2.conclusion: In conclusion, gap years present both clear benefits and challenges. On balance, they work best for disciplined students who maintain focus and plan thoroughly.

models.question: What can be done to reduce childhood obesity?

default.introduction: These days, childhood obesity has become an increasingly serious problem in many countries. It is widely recognised that this crisis affects children's health and future wellbeing significantly. Therefore, it is vital to identify the main problems and discuss effective solutions.

body1.listing: Firstly, it seems that
body1.opinion: unhealthy eating habits are a major cause ...... (reason → example → result)

body2.listing: Secondly, it is generally argued that
body2.opinion: lack of physical exercise contributes significantly ...... (reason → example → result)

body3.listing: However, as far as I can judge
body3.opinion: school education offers an effective solution ...... (reason → example → conditional result)

default.conclusion: In conclusion, childhood obesity can be addressed through determined action. Overall, combining healthier diets, more exercise and school programmes will protect children's health.

alternative1.introduction: Nowadays, childhood obesity represents a growing health crisis in numerous nations. Few people would deny that this epidemic threatens children's current and future health seriously. Hence, it is important to examine key causes and explore practical solutions.

body1.listing: One major problem is that
body1.opinion: poor dietary habits drive ...... (reason → example → result)

body2.listing: Another serious issue is that
body2.opinion: insufficient physical activity contributes heavily ...... (reason → example → result)

body3.listing: Fortunately, as far as I can judge
body3.opinion: educational programmes in schools provide a powerful solution ...... (reason → example → conditional result)

alternative1.conclusion: To sum up, childhood obesity problems can be solved with serious effort. Taking everything into account, improved nutrition, increased activity and school initiatives will safeguard young people's health.

alternative2.introduction: In recent years, obesity among children has emerged as a critical health challenge worldwide. It is common knowledge that this growing problem damages children's physical and mental health substantially. Therefore, it is essential to analyse major contributing factors and consider effective remedies.

body1.listing: To begin with, it seems that
body1.opinion: poor nutrition represents a primary cause ...... (reason → example → result)

body2.listing: Additionally, it is generally argued that
body2.opinion: inadequate exercise levels contribute significantly ...... (reason → example → result)

body3.listing: Nevertheless, as far as I can judge
body3.opinion: school-based interventions offer realistic solutions ...... (reason → example → conditional result)

alternative2.conclusion: In conclusion, childhood obesity can be tackled successfully through committed action. On balance, better eating habits, regular physical activity and comprehensive school programs will protect children's wellbeing.

models.question: What are the causes and effects of social media addiction?

default.introduction: In recent years, social media addiction has become a significant concern among young people. It is widely acknowledged that excessive use has led to serious consequences for mental health. Hence, it is vital to examine the main causes and their resulting effects.

body1.listing: To begin with, it seems that
body1.opinion: one of the main causes of addiction is ...... (reason → example → result)
body1.argument: constant notifications from social media apps

body2.listing: Secondly, it is generally argued that
body2.opinion: another important cause is ...... (reason → example → result)

body3.listing: On the other hand, as far as I can judge
body3.opinion: the effects on mental health are particularly serious ...... (reason → example → result)

default.conclusion: To sum up, social media addiction causes serious problems for individuals. Overall, understanding these causes is essential for addressing this growing issue effectively.

alternative1.introduction: Nowadays, addiction to social media has emerged as a major problem affecting young people worldwide. Few people would deny that overuse creates significant mental health challenges. Therefore, it is important to identify key causes and examine the resulting consequences.

body1.listing: The main cause of this addiction is
body1.opinion: the continuous stream of notifications ...... (reason → example → result)

body2.listing: A further significant cause is
body2.opinion: comparing ourselves unfavorably to others ...... (reason → example → result)

body3.listing: One major effect of addiction is
body3.opinion: deteriorating mental wellbeing ...... (reason → example → result)

alternative1.conclusion: In conclusion, social media addiction generates substantial individual harm. Taking everything into account, recognizing these causes helps develop solutions to this serious problem.

alternative2.introduction: Over recent years, social media addiction has grown into a critical issue particularly among teenagers. It is common knowledge that excessive social media use produces severe mental health impacts. Hence, it is essential to explore underlying causes and analyze their effects.

body1.listing: A primary cause of addiction involves
body1.opinion: the relentless notifications that platforms generate ...... (reason → example → result)

body2.listing: Another key cause is
body2.opinion: unhealthy social comparison ...... (reason → example → result)

body3.listing: The main effect of addiction is
body3.opinion: severely compromised mental health ...... (reason → example → result)

alternative2.conclusion: In conclusion, social media addiction produces damaging consequences for young people. On balance, understanding root causes provides crucial insights for tackling this escalating concern.
